result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clifford S Krauel

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.

2:26 PM Defendant in person. Attny Halyburton. Attny Seifert. Waived. Trial Jan 9th 2023. Tracked 22CF79 with 22CF132. Waive right to pre lim 22CF130. Ct- goes over colloquy with defendant. Attny Halyburton- defendant understands. Ct- Finds defendant has freely voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Finds probable cause felony may have been done by defendant. Attny Halyburton- Plead not guilty on all counts. Trial Jan 9th at 2023 for both cases. Adj 2:334

records.addlTxt: State's Discovery Update Cover Letter

9:58 AM Defendant Clifford S Krauel in court.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Clifford S Krauel.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF132 and 22CF79. Halyburton and Krauel have complains, waives reading of them, requests PH on 22CF132, already had PH on 22CF79, will waive time limits for it. Court sets for PH on 9/28/22 at 2:15 PM.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
State's Discovery Update Cover Letter

ADDRESS INFO for Clifford S Krauel
Current: 603 Keenan Street, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 08-08-2022)
Prior: 913 N Hazeldell, Crandon, WI 54520
State's Initial Discovery Cover Letter

11:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Clifford S Krauel appeared by video, in custody from FOSO.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Clifford S Krauel. Court - here for PH and objection to the bond forfeiture. State calls Officer Steve Ashbeck. Ashbeck sworn in at 11:02 AM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (11:07 AM). Cross exam by Halyburton at 11:07 AM. Ashbeck excused at 11:09 AM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Court - proceed with bail bond forfeiture portion. Halyburton makes offer of proof - informs Court the reason for the failure to appear (fear and trauma), asks Court to reinstate the previous issued bond of $500.00 cash or a high signature bond. Court asks Clerk if the poster was notified of today's hearing. Clerk responds, poster did not check the appropriate box for return of money. Court - believe notice should still be sent per statute. Court denies request to reinstate bond, confirms forfeiture. State - bond - $750.00 cash bond. Krauel asks for signature bond. Halyburton - bond - asks for signature bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - $2,000.00 signature bond with same conditions. Halyburton and Krauel have Information, waives reading of it, proceeds to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts, set for JT. State informs Court that the defendant has a new case, 22CF132, and it is set for INIT on 9/13/22. Court calls that case and reads the charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Halyburton is not appointed to this case yet. Court instructs to contact SPD today to get Atty Halyburton appointed. State - bond - $2,000.00 signature bond - no contact with Safari Motel or Scott Schmidt or his family. Court so orders, sets for AIA on 9/14/22 at 10:00 AM.
No contact with Christopher Roberts.
to signature bond

1:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Clifford S Krauel not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Clifford S Krauel. Halyburton does not have an explanation for his non-appearance. State asks for forfeiture of any bond posted, warrant body or $1500.00 cash. Court asks about amendment. State responds. Court orders bench warrant, body or $1500.00.

Adjourned initial appearance on June 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Clifford S Krauel in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Krauel has complaint, reminds Court that he waived his right to counsel at the last hearing and wants to represent himself, has the waiver of right to attorney form filled out and hands it to Court. Court has waiver, reads charges and penalties again, goes thru the waiver of right to counsel form, Defendant now would like an attorney for stated reasons, will call SPD, asks for bond to be amended to a signature bond. Court supplies defendant with information to contact SPD, instructs defendant to contact them today and until he gets a hold of them. State - bond - asks to continue. Court - bond - continues at this point, reminds him to keep COC and DA updated with his address and ramifications of not doing that, sets for AIA on 6/8/22 at 9:30 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No contact with Christopher Roberts.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:56 AM Defendant Clifford S Krauel in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Krauel has not received a copy of the complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Krauel understands. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Krauel has not, would like to represent himself. Court advises of waiver of right to an attorney that will have to be filled out and gone over with the judge on another date. State asks for bond to be set at the amount that was posted, no contact with Christopher Roberts. Form provided to Krauel in court. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.
